intro: Cyphomandra allophylla, commonly known as the yellow eggplant or golden nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow, egg-shaped fruits that are edible when ripe. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it typically grows in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
